intro: Hieracium grecescui subsp. trisomatum, commonly known as the Greek hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy, elongated stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its yellow flowers bloom from June to August, and it is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. The subspecies trisomatum is distinguished by its specific chromosome number and genetic traits, contributing to its taxonomic classification.
